thread.title: Football: Rashford claims Manchester United will be thirsty for revenge when they face Chelsea in the FA Cup
thread.title_full: Football: Rashford claims Manchester United will be thirsty for revenge when they face Chelsea in the FA Cup

title: Football: Rashford claims Manchester United will be thirsty for revenge when they face Chelsea in the FA Cup
text:
By AFP Tuesday, February 21st 2017 at 00:00 
Marcus Rashford claims Manchester United will be thirsty for revenge when they face Chelsea in the FA Cup. 
Rashford claims United have not forgotten their 4-0 mauling by Chelsea at Stamford Bridge in October and says they want to atone for that humiliation in their quarter-final clash. 
"Yeah, definitely, they've got one over us, so we have to go with the attitude to win basically," said the striker. 
"We're not going there to sit for a draw. We're going there to win the game and that's what everyone expects from Manchester United. 
"At this stage of the competition, you're going to be facing a good team no matter where you go. We're in a good position, so are they. ALSO READ: Football: FA Cup quarter-final draw 
But we will go there confident of winning the game." 
Rashford, 19, who is approaching the first anniversary of his explosive debut against Midtjylland, scored United's equaliser in their fifth-round win over Blackburn to set up the Chelsea showdown. 
He claimed United were determined not to be on the wrong end of another upset after seeing what happened to Burnley and Leicester. 
"You always get the surprises and shocks," he said. "No matter the opponent, we come with the attitude to win every single game. That's important."
